newsitem.title: POLAND: BIG to merge with Gdanski.
newsitem.headline: BIG to merge with Gdanski.

text.p: Polish Bank Inicjatyw Gospodarczych SA (BIG) plans to merge with its 63.4-percent -owned Bank Gdanski SA and to offer Gdanski stockholders new shares to effect the merger, BIG's spokesman said on Friday.

"The merger will be carried out by incorporating Gdanski into BIG....BIG will issue shares to current Bank Gdanski shareholders according to a certain parity which has yet to be set," Wojciech Kaczorowski told Reuters.

He said the decision by both banks' managements had already been approved by their supervisory boards but that the proposal had to be approved by general shareholders meetings of both banks scheduled for late June.
In February BIG became a majority owner of Bank Gdanski after it doubled its stake to about 63 percent, buying shares from the state treasury.
Last month the banks merged their brokerages as BIG's broking subsidiary Dom Maklerski BIG Sp z o.o. incorporated Gdanski's securities unit and took over its clients.
